intro: Werneria graminifolia, commonly known as the grassy werneria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
